p: Despite a slight development slowing, H. officinalis demonstrated the highest increase in plant biomass (35.6%), productivity (34.8%) and essential oil yield (33.3%). The latter parameter reached only a 22.4% increase in A. dracunculus and 9.3 % in L. angustifolia. Though AMF inoculation was reported to elicit plant dry matter accumulation [ 3], no statistically significant increase in this parameter as well as of total dissolved solids (TDS) were recorded in the present study ( Table 1).
